iati-activity.title: Protected Area Management
iati-activity.description: The project will help to ensure that the globally and nationally significant biodiversity of Syria is sustainably used by, and provides benefits to current generations while being conserved for the benefit of future generations.

iati-activity.title: Support to the National TB Programme
iati-activity.description: Support of the National Programme “Tuberculosis” in the Syrian Arab Republic - SYR 607-G01-T
iati-activity.participating-org: GLOBAL FUND TO FIGHT AIDS, TUBERCULOSIS

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: The incidence rate The treatment success rate The notification rate # of TB-MDR detected cases The mortality rate

baseline.comment: The incidence rate of 17 per100000 population - 2013 The treatment success rate of 84% - 2011 The notification rate of 12 per 100000 population - 2013 7 TB-MDR detected cases quarterly - 2013 The mortality rate 2.1 per 100000 - 2013

target.comment: Reach the incidence rate of 17 per 100000 population Reach the treatment success rate of 90% Reach the notification rate 15 per 100000 population Maintain the case detection of the TB-MDR patients to 7 per quarter Reach a mortality rate of 1.4 per 100000

actual.comment: The incidence rate of 17 per 100000 population reached The treatment success rate of 53% reached due to unavailability of data from some Governorates The notification rate of 12 per 100000 population reached The case detection of the TB-MDR patients to 7 per quarter maintained The mortality rate of 2.1 per 100000 maintained Source of Data: Global TB Report November 2014

target.comment: Reach the incidence rate of 17per 100000 population Reach the treatment success rate of 90% Reach the notification rate 12 per 100000 Maintain the case detection of the TB-MDR patients to 7 per quarter Reach the mortality rate of 1.4 per 100000

iati-activity.title: Strengthening HIV Prevention MARPs
iati-activity.description: Strengthening HIV prevention among most-at-risk populations (MARPs) in the Syrian Arab Republic
iati-activity.participating-org: GLOBAL FUND TO FIGHT AIDS, TUBERCULOSIS

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: # of studies among most at risk population( MARPS )successfully conducted and results distributed to stakeholders # of Adults and Children currently receiving Anti Retroviral Therapy..

baseline.comment: 0 studies among most at risk population( MARPS ) 137 Adults and Children currently receiving Anti Retroviral Therapy

target.comment: - Four special studies among most at risk population( MARPS ) to be conducted and results distributed to stakeholders. - 150 of Adults and Children to receive Anti Retroviral Therapy.

actual.comment: - Four special studies among most at risk population( MARPS )successfully conducted and results distributed to stakeholders - 154 Adults and Children receiving Anti Retroviral Therapy.

target.comment: 152 of Adults and Children continue to receive Anti Retroviral Therapy. Piloting services for the prevention of Mother-To-Child Transmission (PMTCT) in three Governorates 100% of Donated Blood units screened for HIV in a quality-assured manner.

iati-activity.title: Strengthening HIV prevention
iati-activity.description: Strengthening HIV prevention among most-at-risk populations (MARPs) in the Syrian Arab Republic
iati-activity.participating-org: GLOBAL FUND TO FIGHT AIDS, TUBERCULOSIS

iati-activity.title: Emerg.Assist for the Restor/Stabilization of Livelihoods
iati-activity.description: Emergency Assistance for the Restoration/ Stabilization of Livelihoods for People Affected by the Crisis in Syria
iati-activity.participating-org: SWISS AGENCY FOR DEVELOPMENT AND COOPERATION - SDC
World Assembly of Muslim Youth - WAMY

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: # of individuals benefiting from assets and tools replacement # of businesses revived / restored productive facilities # of individuals receiving vocational training # of individuals receiving NFI's

baseline.comment: Loss of Livelihoods opportunities Loss of productive tools Loss of essential productive items Increased demand for specific skills training

target.comment: 2500 individual/households benefiting from productive assets, farming inputs, and tools replacement 65 productive facilities restored 350 business revived 1700 beneficiary receiving vocational training 300,000 people receiving NFI's

actual.comment: 203 benefiting from productive tools and assets 606 households receiving farming input 263 businesses revived 4018 receiving vocational training 356,321 NFI's distributed

target.comment: 2000 Jobs created under revived business 700 businesses and handicrafts revived 400 productive assets, tool kits, farming input packages provided 200,000 beneficiary reached with NFIs 1400 people receiving vocational training

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: # of female headed households benefiting from cash for work initiatives # of individuals from vulnerable groups receiving vocational training # of productive workshops established or revived to support FHH # of productive assets and tool kits provided for female headed households and vulnerable youth

target.comment: 700 female headed households benefitted from cash for work initiatives 40 women received vocational training 250 disabled targeted with support

actual.comment: 700 women benefiting from cash for work 159 receiving vocational training 1806 disabled targeted with support

target.comment: 500 jobs created for females heading their households 20 productive workshops established or revived to support female headed households 600 productive assets and tool kits provided for female headed households 150 females receiving vocational training 200 Jobs provided for the disabled

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: # of jobs created (worker month) # of neighborhoods where support to the restoration of solid waste management SWM has led to improved service level # of tools, necessary equipment provided to local actors (for sustainability and continuity of the action) Tons of solid waste removed Liters of pesticides used # of indirect beneficiaries benefiting from improved health and environmental living conditions and repaired infrastructure

baseline.comment: Deteriorated basic social services Disrupted livelihoods (Loss/damage of assets, unemployment, loss of income)

target.comment: 12000 emergency job created (worker month) 50 neighborhoods targeted with solid waste collection 55,000 tons of solid waste removed 10,000 Liter of pesticides used 1,200,000 indirect beneficiary benefiting from improved health and environmental living conditions and repaired infrastructure in target areas

actual.comment: 9,890 emergency job created (worker month) 50 neighborhoods and 78 shelter targeted 71,000 ton of solid waste removed 8,200 liter of pesticides used 1,300,000 total indirect beneficiaries

target.comment: 2680 emergency job created (12750 worker month) 13400 direct beneficiaries reached 75 neighborhoods targeted 90000 ton of solid waste removed 250 KM of water network rehabilitated 3366000 indirect beneficiaries benefiting from better living standards

iati-activity.title: EU Support to Affected Communities in Syria
iati-activity.description: EU Support for Emergency Restoration and Stabilization of Livelihoods in Affected Syrian Communities

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: # of CBOs and NGOs receiving specialized capacity development and training # of NGOs receiving grants to implement local level initiatives # of youth involved in nature of inter and intra-communal activities focusing on social cohesion and community resilience through different entry points

baseline.comment: Loss of livelihood capitals (human, financial, social, physical, natural) Limited CBOs’ capacity to respond to the current unrest in the country and respond to the needs of the affected population Limited local level social cohesion and community resilience activities

target.comment: Assessment of NGOs and CBOs conducted Preparation for the development of the training curriculum for NGOs capacity development initiated

actual.comment: Assessment of 70 NGOs conducted Development of training curriculum initiated

target.comment: Capacity assessment conducted for the capacities of 50 NGOs conducted Three manuals to be prepared on ER&L, NGO management and project cycle management At least 70 NGOs and CBOs trained on livelihoods and early recovery concepts including social cohesion and community resilience. At least 6 NGOs receiving grants to implement local level social cohesion and community resilience initiatives. Piloting the implementation of twinning programme between NGOs/CBOs. 4 peer-to-peer network, Workshops, and Meetings in three governorates conducted Drama therapy, Sport for Peace, Music and Art for Peace, Food for Peace initiatives implemented in the four target governorates

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: # of emergency employment opportunity provided # of neighborhoods where support to the restoration of solid waste management SWM has led to improved service level Tons of solid waste removed Liters of pesticides used # of indirect beneficiaries benefiting from improved health and environmental living conditions and repaired infrastructure

baseline.comment: Deteriorated basic social services Disrupted livelihoods (Loss/damage of assets, unemployment, loss of income, etc.)

target.comment: 3000 emergency employment opportunity provided 10 neighborhoods where support to the restoration of solid waste management SWM has led to improved service level 55000 tons of solid waste removed 800000 indirect beneficiaries benefiting from improved health and environmental living conditions and repaired infrastructure

actual.comment: 9480 emergency employment opportunity provided for one month 32 neighborhoods and 71 shelters targeted 83579 tons of solid waste removed 602762 indirect beneficiaries reached

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: # of beneficiaries provided with productive items and tools # of businesses revived # of individuals receiving vocational training

baseline.comment: Damaged socio-economic infrastructure and SMEs Loss of productive tools Large number of IDPS in need of productive assets Increased demand for specific skills training

target.comment: 700 beneficiaries provided with productive items and tools 200 businesses revived 600 individuals receiving vocational training

actual.comment: 435 beneficiary receiving productive items and tools 500 business revived and 700 provided with farming input 180 received vocational training

target.comment: 600 beneficiary provided with productive tools and assets 600 beneficiary receiving vocational training

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: # of women receiving productive assets and start up kits # of women receiving vocational training # of women benefiting from employment through cash for work schemes

baseline.comment: Increased # of females headed households Increased demand for specific skills training for women

target.comment: -350 women provided with employment through cash for work schemes -350 women provided with start-up kits to revive or start their own business - 400 women trained on new productive skills

actual.comment: 1083 women provided with cash for work opportunity 140 women provided with start up kits 43 women trained on new skills

target.comment: 600 receiving start up kits 850 receiving vocational training
